## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 327, 358, 344]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 325, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 381, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 555, 910, 586]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 586, 598, 601]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 601, 606, 616]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 630, 609, 646]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 646, 757, 661]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 661, 440, 676]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 73, 156, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 72, 541, 92]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\tan 2\theta \cot \theta = 8\), show that \(\tan^2\theta = \frac{3}{4}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 186, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 510, 635, 528]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\tan 2\theta \cot \theta = 8\) for \(0^{\circ}< \theta < 180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 528]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 73, 156, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 73, 462, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(|2x - 5| < |x + 3|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 672, 188, 691]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 672, 789, 691]]<|/det|>
Hence find the largest integer \(y\) satisfying the inequality \(|2\ln y - 5|< |\ln y + 3|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 672, 920, 691]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 358, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the gradient of the curve

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[416, 92, 581, 112]]<|/det|>
\[x^{2}\sin y + \cos 3y = 4\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 117, 280, 137]]<|/det|>
at the point \((2, \frac{1}{2}\pi)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 118, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula based on the equation in part **(i)** to find the value of \(a\) correct to 4 significant figures. Give the result of each iteration to 6 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 393, 92]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[388, 100, 608, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = ax^{3} + bx^{2} - 17x - a,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 920, 163]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants. It is given that \((x + 2)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) and that the remainder is 28 when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x - 2)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 175, 156, 192]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 175, 373, 192]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 175, 920, 192]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 156, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 423, 91]]<|/det|>
Hence factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) completely.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 610, 193, 628]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[201, 610, 755, 628]]<|/det|>
State the number of roots of the equation \(\mathrm{p}(2^{\mathrm{y}}) = 0\), justifying your answer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 610, 920, 628]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 101, 650, 280]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 297, 411, 317]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[393, 324, 603, 345]]<|/det|>
\[y = 2\cos 2x\cos (2x + \frac{1}{6}\pi).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 352, 603, 371]]<|/det|>
The shaded region is bounded by the curve and the two axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 384, 156, 403]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 384, 645, 403]]<|/det|>
Show that \(2\cos 2x\cos (2x + \frac{1}{6}\pi)\) can be expressed in the form

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[395, 411, 603, 431]]<|/det|>
\[k_{1}(1 + \cos 4x) + k_{2}\sin 4x,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 438, 675, 457]]<|/det|>
where the values of the constants \(k_{1}\) and \(k_{2}\) are to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 439, 920, 457]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 484, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the exact area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]
